text: ty for sharing this! i'm currently listening to chap 3 & keep noticing how similar synanon's tactics are to scientology. i google "chuck dietrich scientology" & land on a blog, which didn't answer my q but i see they mention a maria szivalitz.. https://www.trueorbetter.com/2020/05/synanon-self-help-through-shame-and.html?m=1

which of the following issues do you feel most strongly about? this question and more is on the soberlifestyle survey i've been sharing. pls take it here: http://bit.ly/sobersurvey we need 9 more responses to hit 50! harmreduction addiction recoveryworks poll

thank you! i've reached out in the past about stock issues and it's been resolved every time, so i really appreciate it! i was buying quantities of the  honey roasted almonds until the recipe changed last yr.. that was a sad day no other brand compared!

i should also mention that larger clinics with multiple practitioners who accepted walk in appointments were the most willing to treat me, so it's usually where i ended up. but those types of clinics can tend to be revolving doors with crap for care

this is an interesting study, thx for sharing! as a patient in mi that was on opioid therapy for chronic pain (now on bupe) i was shot down constantly when i'd call looking for a new dr. it was only when i didn't ask about specific tx or rx that i could get an appt.
tough as nails!
yes, you did, thanks and hello again! i actually read through your blog and checked out your photos a bit
props! the 1st cpl years are the toughest imo.
recognizing growth is huge! it took me yeeeeeears to understand that. slow learner i suppose lol. props on the big nine zero zero!
congrats!

our voice is crucial to the online recovery and sobriety movement! so if you're sober and have a sec, please contribute to the short sober survey i helped create at http://bit.ly/sobersurvey. tell us what you value most in life right now! recoveryposse soberaf

i used to test myself like this purposely in the beginning (i was a bit too cocky for my own good in my early sobriety lol). it's awesome you walked away and you voiced it. we're much stronger than we think, or than we're led to believe sometimes! recoveryposse

hello folks at , can u please adjust the inventory at store 63 for the meijer glazed honey cinnamon pecan halves? i've visited the store 3x in the past 3 wks (inc today) & shelves have been empty each time. found 4 bags at store 145. purchase 7-10 bags/mo. thank you!
i shop online for things i don't need, take photos, care for succulents, help people with small problems, and try to learn something new!
at the moment of truth, the recovery community is failed once again, by a system that is designed not to save us, but to sacrifice us because our lives always come second.

we still need to hear from a couple more sober people! pls take this short, non-personal, survey about sobriety resources, support groups, recovery content, and socialjustice issues! i helped create it, so it's fun i promise! http://bit.ly/sobersurvey recoveryposse
did you take the survey? if not, pleeeease do we need as much feedback from sober men as possible, so if you have sober friends (any gender) please share with them too!
hi! i'm linking you with , (in case he didn't see your reply) he's looking for sober guys that blog/write about sobriety.. and nice to meet ya!

if you're sober, or if you want to be, this is your chance to have your voice heard, and influence recovery based content for 's new focus of living a sustainable & sober lifestyle. get in on this! recoveryposse addiction soberlife https://forms.gle/b6bys24pjjy2emzh6

how do we get them to change this outdated terminology and harmful definition?! i was delving deeper into samhsa's otp exemptions for telehealth during covid and wasn't expecting this. "...as to endanger the public morals.." excuse me? got. to. go.

of course! it's a shame it's gone this far.. but most wouldn't consider fighting at all, so that's what i like about you. i've dealt with plenty of unjust bullshit and it pisses me off no one will take your case. if i lived nearby i'd sit in court and support you.
done!

i don't know your story but i've seen a few of your tweets mentioning the harm your kids have experienced. please know they'll be stronger in the long run & more informed than most when dealing w/healthcare. to me, it's a long term win- even though it's unfair.
cool fan/light!

i joined in on 's  again. so check it out, it's only 30mins! we touch on: blm, protests & the media, selfcare, covid19 & howto navigate addiction treatment at this time.. cuz why wait? familyaddictioncoach recovery https://familyaddictioncoach.com/all-lives-cant-matter-until-black-lives-matter/

while i'm reading this article about our neighboring city.. the black family across the street is out enjoying the nice weather, 13 large. out of nowhere, 2 white city cops park to quickly visit a fellow officer at home (who is not having a bbq btw).

accountability is thin in michigan. shelby twp. police chief gets paid leave after posting tweets glorifying police brutality. https://www.freep.com/story/news/local/michigan/macomb/2020/06/04/shelby-township-police-chief-police-brutality-posts/3147855001/
my feelings are not important right now, and i know this much is true. so i stay quiet. i read. i learn. i look deep within myself. i change my ways.

it's only fair that i update my  complaint. the order i placed on 5/20 arrived "early" on 6/3 (was sched for the 9th). my order on 6/3 via  will be delivered on 6/7 & 1 item from a diff order on 6/4 is also sched to arrive on 6/7. gapfactory = faster s/h

the 's long shipping delays need to be transparent prior to check out. free 5-7 day shipping = 10-13 biz days. the order i placed on 5/20 is sched to take a total of 20 days to arrive. it's just not worth it for some tee shirts. gap covid

it's a daily battle, but the looting is making it 1000x harder imo, ppl w/addiction & ppl w/chronic pain experience similar levels of oppression & barriers. but i believe its all due to society's deep rooted stigma of addiction (i got a lil philosophical there lol)

i received my absent voter ballot application today (great, thank you!) but i noticed there isn't a "return by date" on the application or the letter. it's not an issue for me.. but i foresee issues for others

is it the pharmacists that are shaming? insurance? it's not about the $, but a $0 copay would help put an end to yet another barrier & petty opportunity for one to shame another. i wish more ppl w/addiction felt empowered & safe to report such behavior.. that would help too
bupe patients have always been stigmatized unfortunately.

dear , my partner ran to our regular store 63 btwn 7:40-8pm on 5/14. approx 1 in 3 shoppers weren't abiding by 's facemask order (posted on the doors). as a devoted, law abiding, long term customer- i want to feel safe upon entry. please fix this. thank you.

no check yet. ssdi beneficiary w/direct deposit in mi. i don't file taxes i did not submit "non-filer" info i'm patient cuz living on an avg week salary for 1 mo is my life, but curious when the will roll out. my long term, no job, no income friend got paid 1st drop.

drove out to my office (couldn't reach by ). appears they're closed for the day, which is ok.. i hope they see my . i the & most providers are closed, but it appears they didn't leave patients hanging 100%. this is a very affluent area. covid_19 in michigan

i had to around for . not cuz i'm hoarding- cuz i didn't have any. can't hoard on ssdi. i had to go out in public. i've been store shelves when i do go out.. michigan     - only stocking in am. doesn't help all. covid_19

how are the people in the californiashutdown getting their controlled medications and medication assisted treatment (methadone, buprenorphrine, etc)? schedule 2 meds do not have refills on them! many drs do not write refills for schedule 3 meds! covid_19

i plan to contact my dr and hope to get my controlled med script slips early, but there's no guarantee i will- along with many many others. especially those who travel to methadone clinics every day for their medication. please please consider those in situations like myself

hi , i live in roseville w/mental & physical chronic illnesses. the controlled meds i'm dependent on require monthly dr appts (no refills). if u enforce a shutdown, will ppl like me be able to see our dr to get our med slips? we will land in er w/o them. pls consider!
i can't help but notice all the masks and rubber gloves littered all over parking lots. covid19

during covid19, treatment providers need to think carefully about how to care for ppl w/sud. ★no one should be left behind or without access to effective treatment. harmreduction strategies need to be front and center.★ ty

it appears cvs is also restricting controlled med pick up to day 30- or the last day of your previous script. but i'm hoping the info i got about this only affected one person's situation, and isn't a new protocol.

i also went to a 24/7  for scripts last night around 10pm. these are the toilet paper, water, thermometers, and lysol sections. the manager said the shipments are held up at the border- no stock coming in.
i know right? i think there's a price checker right there. so everyone dumps the items on the nearest shelf.

they're open 24hrs lol! usually when i go late the shelves are being stocked, and a few were.. but not all. i was hoping to avoid the rush of people during the day, cuz ppl don't care about keeping distance or wearing ppe. 2-4am- although ideal, isn't exactly the safest time

props to all the employees at  trying to fill shelves, despite ppl refusing to stop hoarding. this was meijer's paper goods, milk & thermometer sections on 3/17 at 11pm-12am. still can't find tp or a thermometer w/fast shipping for under $30. yay covid19

i know right? that's why these, and most other boilerplate contracts that's are being used at dr offices must be re-written by the patients that have to sign them. they rarely make sense and often trap patients into situations beyond their control.
yes, that's why i corrected the egregious typo before signing the contract
i'm sure it's a typo, it's just a completely ridiculous one.

this 3 pager is my favorite.. psychological addiction: if i exhibit such behavior i will no longer be considered a candidate for opioid therapy. if i refuse to participate in adjunctive therapies i will be tapered off these medications.

office has the right to terminate this agreement if there is evidence i am no longer receiving a reasonable therapeutic benefit from the medication, or any dr determines that i am no longer a good candidate to continue the med. i love how vague this statement is.
"you must make yourself available for the random pill counts on the date given to you by our staff. if you refuse to do this you will be subject to discharge from the practice"

it's time to re-write the old & outdated boilerplate contracts for pain, opioid, m.a.t., & controlled med patients. the plan: gather, write, seo. this old one said- "i will not carry rx meds w/me in the bottle dispensed from my pharmacist". what?
